algorithm_technique: Frequency counting, combinatorics, and greedy construction
problem_summary_simple: Find the k-th lexicographically smallest palindromic permutation of a given palindromic string.
problem_summary_technical: Calculates combinations to find the k-th permutation by greedily selecting characters based on counts.
key_insights: This problem extends the first by introducing the k-th permutation requirement, necessitating combinatorics.
The solution iteratively determines which character to place next by calculating how many permutations start with smaller characters.
The logic involves calculating combinations (nCr) to count permutations efficiently.
